intro: Buhsea coluteoides, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features a short stem with broad, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in the spring. Buhsea coluteoides is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
